title: 114_s475
content: The "Sugar Reform Act of 2015" may be cited as the Sugar Reform Act. It includes provisions related to the sugar program. The Sugar Reform Act of 2015 includes amendments to the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 regarding sugarcane and sugar beets. Changes include adjusting price support levels for raw cane sugar and sugar beets for specific crop years. The Sugar Reform Act of 2015 includes amendments to the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 regarding sugarcane and sugar beets, including flexible marketing allotments for sugar. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to adjust provisions related to maintaining adequate domestic supplies of sugar at reasonable prices. This includes changes to marketing allotments and considerations for all sources of domestic supply, including imports. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to establish flexible marketing allotments to maintain adequate supplies of sugar at reasonable prices, considering all domestic sources including imports. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to allow the Secretary to suspend or modify provisions if deemed appropriate, considering various interests and competitiveness factors. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to address the competitiveness of domestically produced and imported foods containing sugar through the administration of Tariff Rate Quotas. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to address the competitiveness of domestically produced and imported foods containing sugar through the administration of Tariff Rate Quotas in SEC. 359K. The Secretary shall establish tariff-rate quotas for raw cane sugar and refined sugar to comply with international trade agreements and ensure adequate supplies at reasonable prices in the domestic market. Quotas will be adjusted to maintain a 15.5 percent ratio of sugar stocks to total sugar use at the end of the quota year. The Secretary may establish a different target for the ratio of ending stocks to total use to prevent unreasonably high prices or forfeitures of sugar pledged as collateral. The target will be publicly announced, and adjustments will be made in establishing tariff-rate quotas. The Secretary will consider the impact of quotas on consumers, workers, businesses, and agricultural producers when making adjustments. Temporary transfers of quotas for raw cane sugar and refined sugar between countries can be made with voluntary agreement. The Secretary can make temporary transfers of quotas for raw cane sugar and refined sugar between countries with voluntary agreement. Transfers are valid only for the duration of the quota year and do not affect the share of the quota for the following year. Section 359l(a) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to change the effective period from 2008 to 2015. The Feedstock Flexibility Program for Bioenergy Producers under Section 9010 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is repealed, along with corresponding amendments to the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938.
